title: Your Favorite Cheese Pick?
body:
Just coming off of some hardcore offmeta, so share any stories of your weirdest pick and how it worked!

I used to play a lot of Brand and Viktor top, and it didn't really work unless I was against a squishy. I laned against a Malphite as Brand and that was hell, but toplane Viktor actually worked a few times.

My most recent game was Elise mid, and it was really fun. Tried to creatively counter a Syndra. Ended up with a double and a triple.

Midlane assassin spiderlady OP.

Usually go: {{item:3111}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3065}}

just need a lulu sup in there to hugify the aids factor

if i ever get midlane against another mage.

{{champion:25}}  with {{summoner:12}} 

w, walk away. w, walk away. w, walk away.

go buy, tp back to lane. 

w, walk away. w, walk away. w, walk away.

you get ganked? black shield, walk away.

enemy laner pokes back at you? doesnt matter, your passive keeps you sustained.


build {{item:3027}} {{item:3060}}, and watch the enemy mage struggle to keep up in cs under the turret, unable to roam without losing his turret or multiple minion waves.

worked pretty well for me throughout my climb out of gold, this season.

the champion is legitemately dumb. her only purpose in life is to put so much pressure on the enemy, that he cant influence the game. youre just a push bot in lane, and a second support in teamfights. at mid mmr, people still get cheesed by her. you can not pick an easier champion.
Lit ðŸ…±ick. ðŸ…±ade my evening. ðŸ…±eep up the innovation m8.

I love playing mid Morgana. I used to do the RoA but I've been going for Morellonomicon lately for the mana regen and higher CDR. I also love just being able to walk into bot lane at level 6 and guarantee a kill or multiple blown summs (or both?)

I've yet to try the Banner of Command though, is it still good on her now that there's no AP?

{{champion:3}}  Support

Because he absolutely murders {{champion:81}} , and almost every Support he can be paired off with.
I played him with mf a few times. It was brutal. Siver also good if she knows what she is doing or premade and ult so you can run up to ult.
Tough to say. I like Swiss. But I also like Cheddar and Provolone.

Tahm/Naut mid (albeit I don't think many consider the latter that "cheese" ). In either case, the former counters most melee mids (zed, kat is a skill matchup of sorts, irelia is hard countered) while the latter becomes a bit like a bulkier viktor in that you can push the wave easily and then gank side-lanes.

Sion mid is good into assassins.

Or so they've said.....

> [{quoted}](name=AcidTheWarlock,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lLM6pfqF,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-12-19T01:01:55.977+0000)
>
> Sion mid is good into assassins.
> 
> Or so they've said.....

I tried sion a few times, and he seems tougher to use mid (tahm's cc is easier to land and he can roam to places that sion can't with his ulti). While he is slightly bulkier, unless you have a specific team comp built around him then tahm is just better and easier to play overall.
I take it you play tanks a lot?

> [{quoted}](name=AcidTheWarlock,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lLM6pfqF,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-19T01:06:15.715+0000)
>
> I take it you play tanks a lot?

Kinda. I'm one of those people who tries to solve the meta problems (whether it be the assassins, or stupid stuff like camille) with off-meta answers. Tanks just happen to be one of the few things I've been dabbling with mid in an attempt to counter them.

I feel you bro.

Sometimes it takes some creativity to win.

After all, what you find could be something like the next tank Ekko.

Wait. No. That's a bad analogy. Not at all what I was thinking.

You get the idea.

> [{quoted}](name=AcidTheWarlock,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lLM6pfqF,comment-id=000500000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-19T01:15:10.113+0000)
>
> I feel you bro.
> 
> Sometimes it takes some creativity to win.
> 
> After all, what you find could be something like the next tank Ekko.
> 
> Wait. No. That's a bad analogy. Not at all what I was thinking.
> 
> You get the idea.

Yeah, I actually have a pretty interesting story revolving around that.

Back during the early parts of season 6 I was experimenting with off-meta supports (things like pre-work malz and jarvan). For a stretch of like 20-30 games I played a variant of tank ekko support that did really well into stationary adc's, and kept telling the "group" that I played with on here that he seems like a sleeper OP with a ton of potential. They thought I was crazy for trying it, yet 3 months later tank ekko/fizz were "all the rage".

I jungled with Soraka a couple times.

The salt from the enemy was hilarious.

Can it jungle?!

YES IT CAN!

Panela is good.

I also like Monterrey.
ezreal top against any melee champion is fucking terrible. i played irelia vs ezreal top and he killed me in like 5 autos from level 1 and i felt like the biggest bronze of all time

Twitch jungle with fervor and ignite

Start red and get first blood any lane your close to lvl 2 

Works most of the time :D

Almost any asssassin (prefer {{champion:238}} ) and {{champion:53}} in the botlane.  It works every time (in b5, at least)
{{champion:29}}

fiora adc
sure i have to deal with ranged poke but it actually works
{{champion:12}} FULL AP COW TOP

Fizz Jungle.   He has a distinct weakness in the jungle but when he hits 6 his ganks are inescapable. No counter play.  It's pure cheese.  Doesn't matter if they're under tower or behind tower.  It's guaranteed kill everytime. 

I do want to try Singed Support at some point.

{{champion:164}} Mid

They're so squishy....

AD AS {{champion:117}} Jg
That is all

My favorite cheese pick is actually best as a counter cheese pick. I love going {{champion:20}} top into stuff like {{champion:17}} {{champion:74}} or any other cheese that thinks they are going to have a free lane against a melee bruiser

silly teemo snowball doesnt care about blind and donger turrets are just healthpacks that count as cs

attack speed {{champion:33}} with {{item:1419}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3075}} then some last situational item
then max your w first and when u see the enemy adc, you q, e then w them and they die way too quickly

Sona mid. {{item:3285}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3107}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3020}}  you 100-0 anyone squishy with Q and empowered auto.

-Safe laning phase because of her heal, but good poke and can get solo kills
-Good roaming because of her E
-Easy ganks whenever her ult is up
-Can heal your jungler during and after gank
-Buy Redemption, can heal/get kills from far away
Vel'koz Top.

Tank {{champion:412}}  top.

Pick up AD runes and a dorans blade. This helps you CS and poke ridiculously hard with E max. Rush a frozen gauntlet, follow up hard on ganks and drag people under your tower. Don't ever try to all in though, you have no dueling power, if Riven or some shit goes in on you then E and disengage. In mid game you're a lot stronger than the average Thresh because you have solo lane gold and exp.

{{champion:421}} top

Despite the nerfs she's still a powerful duelist. You W gives incredible sustain and you're manaless. Rush Ravenous Hydra and buy lots of potions to abuse this. You can also hold max fury and press E on the enemy when they try to CS. The real power of Rek'sai top comes from her tunnels, create a solid line of them from your turret to the wave and you become utterly ungankable and unengageable. Buy a ZZ'rot and splitpush forever, the enemy team has to be extremely coordinated in order to deal with you properly. Burrowed Q is great for poke and CSing from range in dangerous matchups.

{{champion:75}} Jungle

Large monsters give the same amount of stacks as a champion, so powerfarming jungle actually gives you far more stacks than a top lane nasus would get. Wither is pretty nice for ganks and Q is really nice for guaranteeing a smite. I forget the exact build, but I prefer to build regular juggernaut items rather than maxing CDR and going full tank like regular nasus.


{{champion:157}} ADC

The passive shield, wind wall and E make him surprisingly good at avoiding poke and harass from the enemy ADC while his 3rd Q can harass back. He farms extremely well so he shouldn't ever be too far behind. He follows up on ganks and support engages extremely well and come mid game he two shots carries. Builds just like a regular Yasuo. Masteries though should be warlords plus 12 points in the defensive tree, health regen, blocking poke, increased healing and whatever the fuck. The hardest part is keeping your teammates off tilt.

Honorable mention: {{champion:32}} top. Your trades are ridiculous because you block minion damage and minion AAs reset your E.

honestly adc yasuo with support braum is fun as hell to play

ive done it a few times with complete strangers but the synergy is so good you win by smashing your face on the keyboard anyway
Nunu and Galio back when no one played them. I seemed to be the only (low elo) play to use them. They have always been fairly powerful, just no one uses them.
